pr_title: refactor: unify mimetype and file extensions
summary: Greptile caught a missing dot prefix typo in the file extensions constants (`"json"` instead of `".json"`), which would break JSON file validation since the extension comparison relies on consistent dot-prefixed format.

pr_title: Auto scheduler for TMA inner reduction
summary: Greptile identified a commented-out architecture check that would incorrectly enable TMA on unsupported GPU architectures, potentially causing crashes or incorrect behavior.

pr_title: feat: migrate authentication from WorkOS to Better Auth with GitHub OAuth
summary: Greptile identified three critical security and authentication bugs in this WorkOS to Better Auth migration: (1) sign-out fails silently due to deleting cookies with incorrect names, leaving users authenticated when they think they've logged out, (2) missing Secure flags on session cookies make them vulnerable to interception over HTTP, and (3) the migration logic enables account takeover by linking accounts based solely on email matching without proper verification.

pr_title: Stage
summary: Greptile identified two medium-severity bugs: an authentication logic issue where users get stuck in an unauthenticated state with no recovery path when auth fails, and a data integrity bug where cached status progress values could leak between tenants, potentially causing tasks to be updated with incorrect status IDs from other organizations.

pr_title: [Changelog] New changelog app
summary: Greptile caught a critical configuration incompatibility where the changelog app is set up for static export but includes an API route that will fail at runtime since Next.js static exports don't support API routes.

pr_title: feat: rate limiter improvement (fetch daily limit, show error with google form link)
summary: Greptile identified a database migration bug where a column was removed from the schema definition without properly migrating existing SQLite databases. This would cause INSERT statement failures in production since existing tables still expect the old 4-column structure while the new code only provides 3 values, breaking existing installations.

pr_title: collision fix
summary: Greptile caught a significant logic bug where squared distance is compared to a linear distance threshold, causing the max segment length constraint to be approximately 22x smaller than intended, which would break the collision detection fix.

pr_title: feat: deep research continued
summary: Greptile caught two critical logic bugs: an infinite loop caused by incrementing the wrong counter variable (`llm_cycle_count` instead of `cycle_count`), and a data loss issue where collected documents are discarded by returning a hardcoded empty list instead of the gathered results. Both bugs would cause the research feature to malfunction completely.

pr_title: feat: deep research more dev stuff
summary: Greptile caught a runtime bug where function calls weren't updated after the function signature was modified to require two new parameters (`is_reasoning_model` and `user_identity`). This mismatch between the function definition and its call sites would cause TypeError exceptions when the code executes.

pr_title: remove old models
summary: Greptile caught an incomplete refactoring where model definitions were removed from the codebase but references to those models still remained in other files. This would cause runtime failures when the application tries to look up the deleted model IDs.

pr_title: fix click jacking
summary: Greptile correctly identified that importing DOMPurify directly (instead of isomorphic-dompurify) in Next.js components will cause runtime crashes during server-side rendering because DOMPurify requires the DOM/window object which doesn't exist on the server.

pr_title: [2.7] Redesign Cifar10 PT
summary: Greptile caught a runtime error where `.cpu()` was called on a dictionary instead of a tensor, which would cause an AttributeError crash during federated learning client execution.

pr_title: fix(tf): Instance Configurability
summary: Greptile correctly identified a logic error where the final fallback in a ternary chain uses `v.instance_types` which will always be `null` at that point (since the condition already checked it was null). This would cause node groups other than 'main' or 'vespa' to have null instance types, likely causing Terraform errors or unexpected behavior.

pr_title: feat: Deep Research works till the end
summary: Greptile identified a variable scoping bug where `tool_call` is a leftover loop variable from a previous iteration that gets reused in subsequent loops. This causes all ToolCallInfo objects and research results to be incorrectly associated with the last tool call instead of their actual originating calls, leading to silent data integrity issues where research results are attributed to the wrong tools.

pr_title: feat(new vector db interface): Plug in delete for Vespa
summary: Greptile caught a real regression where the refactored delete_single method no longer deletes documents from the secondary index, which the old implementation handled by iterating through all indices in index_to_large_chunks_enabled.

pr_title: improvement(hitl): show resume url in tag dropdown within hitl block
summary: Greptile caught two implementation gaps in the human-in-the-loop self-reference feature: missing filtering logic that would expose unavailable fields to users (causing broken references and poor UX), and an incomplete update that missed one of three parallel code paths (causing the feature to work inconsistently across different scenarios).

pr_title: feat: v0.0.36, invisible execution, with cyberdriver logs
summary: This is a subtle but real escaping bug in VBScript string construction. The code applies Windows command-line escaping (`\"`) before VBScript string escaping (`""`), resulting in malformed VBScript that would fail to properly launch processes with arguments containing quotes. This double-escaping interaction is non-obvious and would cause real failures in the invisible execution feature on Windows.

pr_title: feat: add killer features (chameleon, invisible ink, chat heads, shortcuts)
summary: Greptile caught a critical security vulnerability where the chat head BrowserWindow is created with nodeIntegration enabled and contextIsolation disabled, which violates Electron security best practices and could allow malicious code execution.

pr_title: Add basic network support
summary: Greptile caught multiple real concurrency bugs: race conditions causing panics when sending to closed channels during TCP listener/connection lifecycle, and a buffer pooling bug where frames are returned to the pool while the backend may still hold references, causing potential data corruption.

pr_title: fix(sanitization): added more input sanitization to tool routes
summary: Greptile identified that while the PR added input sanitization to tool routes, it missed validating the `messageId` parameter in Gmail label routes before interpolating it into URL paths. This creates a path traversal vulnerability where malicious messageIds containing sequences like '../' could manipulate API request paths, despite other parameters being properly validated.

pr_title: fix(authentication): added auth checks for various routes, mysql and postgres query validation, csp improvements
summary: This identifies a real SQL injection vulnerability where user-controlled values in WHERE clauses are embedded as raw strings rather than parameterized, even though the PR claims to add query validation. While validateWhereClause may block some patterns, embedding raw strings in SQL is a genuine security risk that could allow injection through edge cases the validation doesn't cover.

pr_title: fix: Incorrect buffer pool calculation strategy when reading CSV
summary: Greptile caught an incomplete refactoring where chunk_size semantics were changed from bytes to rows in the local reader, but the remote reader path was not updated, creating inconsistent behavior between local and remote CSV reading.

pr_title: Enable arithmetic operations between device tensors/batches and scalars
summary: Greptile caught two real bugs: a logic error in the two-pass device detection that breaks `scalar + gpu_tensor` operations, and a Python version compatibility issue with isinstance union syntax that would fail on Python 3.8/3.9.

pr_title: SDK pipeline
summary: This is a real bug - the Delete function uses 'user_id' as the column name while all other queries in the file consistently use '"$user_id"' (with quotes and dollar sign). This inconsistency would cause the delete operation to fail or insert into the wrong column, breaking user deletion functionality. The bug is non-obvious as it's easy to miss the subtle naming difference across different functions.

pr_title: fix(seed): use predefined admin credentials instead of auto-generated
summary: Greptile caught a real data integrity issue where a migration updating related user and account tables lacks transaction atomicity, which could leave the database in an inconsistent state if one update succeeds and the other fails.

pr_title: fix: add alert revamp v2
summary: Greptile caught a real SQL injection vulnerability where user input is directly interpolated into LIKE clauses in SQL query generation without proper escaping, which could allow attackers to execute arbitrary SQL through alert condition values.

pr_title: Add debounced input component
summary: Greptile caught a legitimate memory leak issue where debounced functions are recreated without cancelling previous ones, causing old timeouts to accumulate. This is a real bug that would affect production behavior.

pr_title: fix: show duplicate accounts with no org attached and fix duplicate invited accounts
summary: This is a legitimate race condition in security-critical signup code. Concurrent signup completions could bypass the duplicate cleanup since all requests would query before any deletions occur, potentially allowing multiple accepted accounts for the same email. The fix using FOR UPDATE locking is correct and actionable.

pr_title: fix(redaction): consolidate redaction utils, apply them to inputs and outputs before persisting logs
summary: Greptile caught a logic bug where the redaction code was incorrectly applying sensitive key pattern checks (like 'token', 'secret', 'auth') to string values instead of just object keys. This would cause legitimate user data containing these common words (like "authentication token required" or "secret santa") to be incorrectly redacted.

pr_title: refactor: consolidate SessionDetailsModal and GroupDetailsModal into single component
summary: This is a legitimate bug where ensureSessionsPersistence returns undefined in group mode when there are no sessions, but the calling code at lines 395, 440, and 594 uses the returned ID without checking for undefined. This would cause runtime errors or incorrect behavior when trying to perform curriculum/document operations with an undefined session ID.

pr_title: fix(autofill): add dummy inputs to prevent browser autofill for various fields, prevent having 0 workflows in workspace
summary: This is a valid catch of an incomplete feature implementation - the PR adds protection against deleting the last workflow via folder deletion, but the same protection is missing from the direct workflow deletion API, creating an inconsistent bypass. This is a real logic gap that would allow users to circumvent the intended business rule.

pr_title: Add SEA binary build for packages/server
summary: Greptile caught a package filter typo in the Windows CI workflow that builds the wrong package, which would cause the Windows SEA binary build to fail.

pr_title: Stage
summary: Greptile caught a critical runtime bug where the code calls `server.registerTool()` instead of the correct MCP SDK method `server.tool()`, which would cause all 324+ tools to fail at runtime since the method doesn't exist. This API mismatch would completely break the MCP server functionality and was hidden by `as any` type casting.

pr_title: Fix bug in agent view for jerk dynamics model
summary: This identifies a real consistency bug where a hardcoded value '7' should be the constant 'PARTNER_FEATURES' to match a similar fix elsewhere in the same loop. If PARTNER_FEATURES changes from 7, this would cause incorrect indexing through partner observations, leading to data corruption or incorrect behavior. This is a non-obvious bug that requires understanding the context of a related fix.

pr_title: fix(subflow): prevent auto-connect across subflow edges with keyboard shortcut block additions, make positioning for auto-drop smarter
summary: This is a valid logic bug - the original code only prevents cross-container edges in one direction (insideâ†’root) by checking if closestBlockParentId exists but targetParentId doesn't. The fix correctly uses inequality comparison to catch both directions, preventing invalid workflow connections between different container scopes.

pr_title: fix(logs): always capture cost, logging size failures
summary: This is a legitimate logic flaw in fallback/recovery code. The fallback handler `completeWithCostOnlyLog` processes the same `traceSpans` that may have caused the original failure, meaning the fallback itself could fail for the same reason. This defeats the purpose of having a fallback and could result in lost cost data. The fix is specific and actionable.

pr_title: Collision checking fixes
summary: Greptile caught two real NULL pointer dereference bugs in C code: one where checkNeighbors returns NULL on invalid positions but the caller doesn't check before iterating, and another where calloc failure isn't handled before using the allocated memory.

pr_title: Harden pi carrier stack rendering guardrails
summary: Greptile caught a real bug where the refactoring introduced `carrier_dims_resolved` but failed to update all references from `carrier_dims`, leaving undefined variable references that would cause runtime errors in OpenSCAD rendering.

pr_title: fix(categories): remove duplicate pagination in categories page
summary: Greptile caught that removing the pagination component while leaving the pagination state/logic creates a broken standard pagination mode where users see paginated results but cannot navigate between pages.

pr_title: feat(subscription): add subscription expiration management system
summary: Greptile caught a critical bug where subscription creation ignores the requested plan type and always creates STANDARD plans, plus a security issue where the cron endpoint fails open without authentication when CRON_SECRET is not configured.

pr_title: Stage
summary: Greptile identified a critical environment variable naming inconsistency in ARM64 build workflows, where `DESKTOP_AGENT_APP_*` prefixes are used instead of the expected `AGENT_APP_*` prefixes. This copy-paste error would cause the bump-version script to fail and break ARM64 CI/CD builds across multiple workflow files.

pr_title: feat(audit): added audit log for billing line items
summary: Greptile caught a real cursor pagination bug where records with identical timestamps could be duplicated or skipped across pages due to inconsistent ordering.

pr_title: feat(core): add pagination to getVersions endpoint
summary: Greptile caught a real validation bug where `safeParse` is called but its result is ignored, allowing invalid `page_size` values to be passed to the API without any error handling.

pr_title: feat(settings): added snap to grid slider to settings
summary: This catches a real validation mismatch where the backend schema allows values up to 100 but the UI only allows up to 50. This could allow API requests to bypass UI constraints and store invalid values, or cause validation failures for values that should be valid. The inconsistency between layers is a genuine bug that could cause unexpected behavior.

pr_title: âœ¨ : Planner envelope warns on bounds
summary: This is a real logic bug where the animation captures a stale opacity value at initialization time, but the code later dynamically changes the material opacity for warnings. The animation would use the old baseOpacity value instead of the updated warning opacity, causing the visual warning flash to be less intense than intended. The fix using a getter function is correct and actionable.

pr_title: fix(notion): remove hyphenation of incoming page ID's
summary: This is a real bug where the PR removes UUID hyphenation formatting but the Notion blocks API still requires hyphenated UUIDs. The diff shows the formatting code was removed, but the pageId is still used directly in the blocks endpoint, which would cause API calls to fail. This is a non-obvious regression that could easily be missed.

pr_title: Carla2d towns
summary: Greptile caught a critical velocity calculation bug where the code subtracts the current position from itself instead of using the previous position, resulting in zero velocity values in the generated trajectory data.

pr_title: fix: sanitize postgres to remove nul characters
summary: Greptile identified that the PR only partially fixes the NUL character issue - two other functions (`create_search_doc_from_inference_section` and `update_search_docs_table_with_relevance`) write to the same database table without applying the new sanitization, leaving the vulnerability open through alternative code paths.

pr_title: fix(iceberg): disable count pushdown when delete files are present
summary: Greptile caught two real bugs: using the wrong Iceberg metadata field (`deleted-data-files` instead of `total-delete-files`) which would fail to detect delete files, and a type error where string values from the summary would be incorrectly compared as integers.

pr_title: feat: add parallel tool execution support
summary: Greptile caught a missing f-string prefix in terminal_state_title() that would display literal placeholder text instead of interpolating the tool name. The other comments about KeyboardInterrupt handling and race conditions are valid design concerns but are theoretical issues rather than concrete bugs.

pr_title: Implement user project tables with cross-device persistence
summary: Greptile identified security vulnerabilities in the snapshot API endpoints where project ownership is not validated before access, and caught a silent failure mode in RLS context setup that could lead to authorization bypasses. Also found a logic error in URL slug generation.

pr_title: Add `Fizzy` extension
summary: Greptile identified a subtle variable shadowing bug in notification handling where the comparison always returns true, causing bulk updates instead of individual notification updates.

pr_title: feat(cli): Generate package
summary: Greptile caught real bugs where the package generator was copy-pasted from the job generator without proper adaptation - hardcoded `{extension}` literal strings instead of variable interpolation, and test/scenario files being written to the wrong directory (api/jobs instead of packages).

pr_title: DR bug fixes
summary: This is a valid logic bug - after generating the final report on the last cycle, the code continues execution and will make additional unnecessary LLM calls and potentially process tools, wasting resources and potentially corrupting state. The missing `break` statement means the early exit logic is incomplete.

pr_title: improvement(supabase): allow non-public schemas
ðŸ›¡ï¸ : â€“ Add data wipe controls to settings
summary: Greptile caught a real data integrity bug where the fallback database list for data wiping is missing the 'CustomContent' database, meaning users in certain browsers wouldn't have their data fully cleared as expected.

pr_title: ðŸ  : â€“ Adjust aquaria quest prerequisites
summary: Greptile identified a circular dependency in the quest prerequisite system: water-testing requires sponge-filter, but sponge-filter's dependency chain would need water-testing to complete first, creating an impossible-to-complete quest scenario. This is a real logic bug that would block user progression and could easily be missed in code review.

pr_title: [raycastbot] Improve Regex for issue-bot
summary: Greptile caught a subtle regex bug where an inconsistent use of capturing vs non-capturing groups would cause capture group indices to shift when the optional `https://` is present, breaking the extension folder extraction logic.

pr_title: fix(onboarding): Azure llm url parsing
summary: Greptile caught a subtle boolean operator precedence issue in the model selector's disabled state logic that would cause incorrect behavior - the field would never be disabled for Azure providers but would be incorrectly disabled for all other providers.

pr_title: feat(upgrade): migrate from k8s to nginx ingress controller
summary: Greptile identified a critical migration bug where the script deletes the old ingress controller before deploying the new one, causing service downtime during upgrades. It also caught ordering issues with Kubernetes CRDs being applied after Helm upgrades (which would cause deployment failures) and a runtime bug with uninitialized variables that could crash the script.

pr_title: fix: Layout fix + CSR updates
summary: This is a valid breaking API change catch - the component's interface was narrowed from accepting all HTML div attributes (including className for custom styling) to only accepting children. Greptile correctly identified specific pages that depend on this capability, which would silently lose their custom styling after this change.

pr_title: Move to nose2 only
summary: Greptile caught a real import error bug where test_functional_api.py still imports the 'nose' package that's being removed as a dependency, which would cause test failures.

pr_title: dev
summary: The comments about UTM materialized views selecting 'referrer' instead of the correct UTM fields (utm_source, utm_medium, utm_campaign) are real data integrity bugs that would populate autocomplete features with completely wrong data. This is a non-obvious copy-paste error in SQL schema that would silently corrupt analytics data and would be easy to miss during review.

pr_title: feat(ingestion): restore delete api
summary: This is a legitimate data consistency bug - if the database operation fails after the Vespa delete succeeds, you get an orphaned database record pointing to deleted index data. The suggested fix to delete from DB first is correct: if the index delete then fails, you can at least re-ingest, whereas the current order leaves the system in an inconsistent state that's harder to recover from.

pr_title: feat(new vector db interface): Implement retrievals for Vespa
summary: Greptile correctly identified that the `random_retrieval` method generates invalid YQL syntax when called with `filters=None`, as the query ends with `where ` without any condition. This would cause runtime errors in production.

pr_title: Feat/image config backend
summary: Greptile caught a resource leak bug where deleting an ImageGenerationConfig leaves orphaned LLM provider records in the database, an inconsistency with the update flow which correctly cleans up old providers.

pr_title: feat(eval): implement DockerGPTMeEnv for Docker-isolated gptme execution
summary: Greptile caught a legitimate command injection vulnerability where user-controllable parameters (model, tool_format, tools, system_prompt) are passed unescaped to a shell command, allowing potential arbitrary command execution inside Docker containers.

pr_title: fix: generate empty ttv file when index field not present in parquet
summary: Greptile caught a subtle variable shadowing bug that would cause the new empty index creation feature to fail silently when only index_fields (without FTS fields) are configured but not present in the parquet data.

pr_title: fix(docprocessing): Using locks to stop retries
summary: Greptile caught two critical bugs: (1) a concurrency issue where the code cancels all pending async operations whenever the event loop is retrieved, causing random CancelledErrors for legitimate operations, and (2) a runtime error where the retry decorator uses an invalid 'max_delay' parameter that would cause a TypeError when executed for non-Google providers.

pr_title: fix(docprocessing): Move to Sync
summary: Greptile caught a real event loop blocking bug where a synchronous function was being called directly from an async context, which would freeze all concurrent async operations until the API calls complete.

pr_title: fix(google): Fix Embedding with Vertex
summary: Greptile caught two bugs in the Vertex AI client pooling logic: 1) A resource leak where old clients are referenced but never actually closed, and 2) A security/correctness issue where Python's randomized hash function could cause credential mixing between users or cache misses across processes.

pr_title: fix: download cloud svg
summary: This is a real bug - React/JSX requires camelCase for SVG attributes, and using kebab-case like `stroke-width` instead of `strokeWidth` will cause React warnings and the attributes won't be applied correctly, resulting in broken SVG rendering. While somewhat basic React knowledge, this could easily slip through in a copy-paste from external SVG source.

pr_title: Fix LR recipe and persistor issue
summary: Greptile caught a breaking change where the refactoring of NPModelPersistor's inheritance pattern would cause existing subclasses that set `self.default_data` to silently use incorrect default values, since they weren't updated to override the new `_get_initial_model_as_numpy()` method.

pr_title: Break down inventory misc category into explicit groups
summary: Greptile caught duplicate ID entries across categories that would cause incorrect item categorization due to Map construction order. This is a real data integrity bug that would silently assign items to wrong categories.

pr_title: feat: CARE Meeting Module for student support tracking
summary: Greptile caught data integrity bugs where the TypeScript interface and UI components expect `teacher_id` and `teacher_name` fields, but the Supabase query doesn't fetch these fields and they're missing from the database schema types. This mismatch would cause undefined values in the UI and potential TypeScript errors when accessing teacher information.

pr_title: Impose more strict type checking
summary: Greptile caught a real type signature mismatch where the step() method's implementation signature didn't match its overload declarations, which would cause mypy type checking to fail and could lead to runtime issues when callers pass callable closures.

pr_title: feat(anthropic): add native structured outputs support (November 2025 API)
summary: This is a real logic bug where a string prefix check won't match the actual model ID, causing the feature detection to fail silently. The model ID 'claude-haiku-4-5' would not match the prefix 'claude-3-5-haiku', breaking structured output support for that model. This is non-obvious as it requires cross-referencing model IDs across files.

pr_title: Solve pytorch-triton and triton package contention
summary: Greptile identified a variable name typo (`compile` vs `compiled`) that would cause a NameError at runtime for users with JAX versions below 0.8.2.

pr_title: Add code to publish binaries on release
summary: This is a legitimate bug where the Windows build step uses the wrong pnpm filter (`@browserbasehq/stagehand` instead of `@browserbasehq/stagehand-server`), which would cause the Windows binary build to fail or build the wrong package. The Linux/macOS step correctly uses `@browserbasehq/stagehand-server`, making this an easy typo to miss during review.

pr_title: feat: add School Psychologist as provider role option
summary: Greptile caught incomplete feature implementation where 'psychologist' role was added to some files but missed in the school detail page UI components and the CARE assignment database function, which would cause functionality gaps for district admins trying to create or assign school psychologists.

pr_title: improvement(pricing): increase free user limit to 20 usd
summary: This identifies a real inconsistency bug where a duplicated constant exists in two places - one being updated and one not. New users would get 10 credits in the database but the app would expect 20, causing real behavioral inconsistency. This cross-file duplication issue is non-obvious and a human reviewer focused on the single file change would likely miss it.

pr_title: Update doppler-share-secrets extension
summary: Greptile caught a real breaking change from the `got` library major version upgrade (v11â†’v14) that would cause runtime failures in the secret sharing API call due to removed `responseType: 'json'` option and changed response structure.

pr_title: ðŸš€ : â€“ Improve cloud sync backups UX and security
summary: Greptile correctly identified a logic bug where `|| trimmed.length > 0` causes the token validation function to accept any non-empty string as valid, completely defeating the purpose of the regex patterns designed to validate GitHub token formats.

pr_title: fix: throw lock on tmux tool new_session to prevent race
summary: Greptile caught a subtle but critical concurrency bug where a lock decorator was creating a new lock instance per decoration rather than sharing a module-level lock, which would have left the intended race condition completely unprotected.

pr_title: Flesh out TCP support in Netstack and add outbound connections.
summary: Greptile identified two critical out-of-bounds vulnerabilities in TCP option parsing where malformed packets could cause infinite loops, memory corruption, or crash the network stack by accessing invalid array indices. Both issues stem from insufficient bounds checking when parsing TCP option lengths before advancing through the options array.

pr_title: debug: added new debug command to handle bulk data
summary: This is a real initialization bug. In Go, time.Time zero value is year 1 (0001-01-01), not epoch. The condition `ts.Before(r.earliest)` will almost never be true since nearly all real timestamps are after year 1, causing `earliest` to always remain at the zero value instead of tracking the actual earliest entry. This would break the TimeRange() API and any code depending on accurate earliest timestamp tracking.

pr_title: Add symlink support to virtio-fs
summary: This is a real indentation/syntax bug in Go code where the `if child != nil` block is incorrectly dedented, breaking the nesting structure and causing the type check logic to execute outside the intended `if cachedID` block. This would cause incorrect directory entry type detection in the virtio-fs implementation.

pr_title: feat: incident detail drawer enhancements - telemetry tabs and alert graph
summary: Greptile caught a real bug where a copy-to-clipboard button only shows a success notification without actually copying the value, which would confuse users who think they copied dimension values but actually didn't.

pr_title: [Badges] Add support for Windows
summary: Greptile caught a subtle but significant logic bug where the `isWindows` variable uses `!==` instead of `===`, causing Windows-specific feature disabling to be applied to the wrong platforms.

pr_title: feat: add CARE dashboard restrictions for teachers
summary: Greptile caught a critical authorization bypass vulnerability where teacher access restrictions are implemented client-side only. The RLS policies allow any authenticated school user to SELECT/UPDATE/DELETE all referrals, meaning teachers can bypass UI restrictions by directly calling API functions.

pr_title: Refactor schedule session filtering and time formatting
summary: This is a legitimate logic bug where a refactor accidentally changed the filtering behavior - the specialist filter now shows ALL sessions with delivered_by === 'specialist' instead of only the current user's own sessions that they assigned out. This is a non-obvious regression that could expose sessions users shouldn't see, and Greptile correctly identified it by comparing to the original implementation.

pr_title: chore: cleanup drupal connector nits
summary: This is a real bug - the code removes the initialization of `_api_token` but the attribute is still used in `_download_attachment`. If `_download_attachment` is called before `load_credentials`, it will raise an `AttributeError`. This is a non-obvious issue introduced by the refactoring that could cause runtime crashes.

pr_title: improvement(usage): update usage limit in realtime, standardize token output object across providers
summary: This identifies a field name mismatch between a refactored function returning `input`/`output` token fields and consuming code still expecting `prompt`/`completion` names, causing token data to be silently lost during merging. This is a non-obvious integration bug that would likely slip through review when refactoring naming conventions across multiple files.

pr_title: Print Week improvements: view labels, shape differentiation, and single-page fit
summary: Greptile caught a logic bug where the PDF legend incorrectly claims shapes indicate "Assigned to Me" when the code actually shows shapes for sessions assigned to ANY user, not just the current user. Additionally, there's a bug where students with duplicate initials (rather than duplicate IDs) would be incorrectly filtered out of the PDF export.

pr_title: fix: masking
summary: This is a legitimate bug fix - using `.get('api_key', '')` doesn't protect against explicit `None` values in the dictionary, which would still be returned and cause a TypeError when `mask_string()` tries to perform string slicing operations. The fix with `or ''` properly handles both missing keys and explicit `None` values. This is non-obvious because many developers confuse `.get(key, default)` behavior with falsy value handling.

pr_title: feat(pam): implement browser-accessible PAM session for postgres
summary: Comments 1-3 and 5 identify a critical authorization bypass vulnerability where any authenticated user can access, query, and terminate ANY other user's PAM session by simply knowing the sessionId UUID. This is a severe security flaw in privileged access management code that could lead to SQL injection attacks on privileged databases, data theft, and denial of service - exactly the kind of non-obvious security issue that could easily slip through human review.

pr_title: [fix] Menus shouldn't cut off their content anymore
summary: This is a legitimate logic inconsistency - the drawer's top position varies by breakpoint (60px mobile, 76px desktop) but the max-height calculation only accounts for the desktop value, causing a 16px overflow on mobile. The catch demonstrates careful cross-referencing of responsive breakpoint values that a human reviewer could easily miss.

pr_title: Guard conflicting allow-remote-access flags
summary: This is a real logic bug - when parsing space-separated flag values like '--allow-remote-access true', the loop fails to skip the consumed 'true' argument, causing it to be processed again as a standalone argument. This would cause incorrect parsing with multiple flags and is non-obvious since it requires understanding the loop's iteration behavior.

pr_title: feat(schedules): remove save button for schedules, couple schedule deployment with workflow deployment
summary: Greptile caught a logic bug where a return statement inside a loop causes only the first schedule block to be created/updated during deployment, silently dropping all other schedule blocks in multi-schedule workflows.

pr_title: Fix aquaria asset paths and formatting
summary: This is a real bug where image paths in JSON files were updated to point to /assets/ but the actual image files weren't moved from /assets/quests/, causing 404 errors in production. This is a non-obvious cross-file consistency issue that would cause immediate visual failures when loading inventory items.

pr_title: Fix Gemini pricing and remove 5.2 pin
summary: The Gemini pricing order bug is a legitimate logic error - if the pricing system uses sequential matching with `includes`, placing specific model entries after generic patterns would cause incorrect price matching. This is a non-obvious ordering dependency that would cause real financial impact (wrong billing) and is easy to miss during code review.

pr_title: refactor: remove icon prop from UserFilesModal
summary: Greptile identified a missed call site during refactoring - AssistantEditor.tsx still passes the removed 'icon' prop, which would cause TypeScript compilation errors. This is a real incomplete refactoring bug that could be missed when reviewing only the changed files, though TypeScript would eventually catch it at build time.

pr_title: Justin/update to use in memory cache
summary: Greptile identified cache synchronization and data integrity bugs in the PR's two-level caching implementation. The main issues are that duplicate provider keys accumulate without deduplication (unlike the previous Map-based approach) and updates to the KV cache don't invalidate the in-memory cache, causing stale data to be served on subsequent requests.

pr_title: provider key cache
summary: This is a real logic bug where multiple provider keys from the same provider (e.g., two different OpenAI API keys) would collide in the Map when they lack a cuid, causing data loss as later keys overwrite earlier ones. This is non-obvious and could cause incorrect key selection in production.

pr_title: fix(shell): prevent orphaned bg jobs and support bg on non-first line (Issues #992, #993)
summary: Greptile caught a real bug where the PR's orphan cleanup mechanism is incomplete - background jobs spawned with `start_new_session=True` create process groups, but the kill() method only terminates the parent bash process, not child processes, defeating the PR's stated purpose of preventing orphaned processes.

pr_title: Justin/sentinenl cache
summary: This is a real race condition - concurrent requests for different providers read the same cache, append their keys independently, and write back asynchronously. The last write wins, potentially losing provider keys that were added by concurrent requests. The suggested fix using filter by provider before appending correctly addresses this by making the operation idempotent for each provider.

pr_title: Add version 2 of debug tool and made it public
summary: This is a real bug - when using `-tail` with a custom limit (not 100), if there are fewer entries than the limit, the code will panic with a negative slice index (e.g., entries[len(entries)-*limit:] where len(entries) < *limit). The fix correctly adds the bounds check before slicing.

pr_title: fix: add visibility toggle for show/hide PromQL queries while adding panel
summary: Greptile caught a real index management bug where removing a query tab doesn't update the hiddenQueries array, causing subsequent queries to be incorrectly hidden due to stale indices.

pr_title: fix(pricing): update LemonSqueezy variant selection logic
summary: Greptile caught two significant bugs: a currency formatting issue where prices stored in cents would display incorrectly (e.g., showing "1999" instead of "$19.99" in customer emails), and a data integrity problem where removing the primary key constraint from verification tokens could allow duplicates and cause authentication failures.

pr_title: feat(cli): pre-upgrade scripts
summary: Greptile caught a critical runtime bug where the code attempts to execute TypeScript files directly with Node.js, which would fail with syntax errors and make the entire pre-upgrade scripts feature non-functional.

pr_title: p2p: rework duplicate message rejections
summary: Greptile caught a real logic bug where a hardcoded error constant was used instead of the function parameter, breaking the violation tracking system that distinguishes between different error types per peer.

pr_title: Feat/integrate url extraction
summary: Greptile caught a type mismatch bug where the API client returns unwrapped data but the code expects a wrapped response object (causing all requests to fail), and a schema/variable name mismatch that would break environment variable validation.

pr_title: feat : Add version settings and API endpoint to display application version
summary: Greptile caught a real runtime bug where the new version API endpoint reads package.json from the filesystem, which won't exist in Docker standalone builds, causing silent failures in production. The review correctly identified that an existing build-time constant (CURRENT_VERSION) already provides this functionality reliably.

pr_title: fix: add teacher-level RLS filtering for CARE referrals
summary: This is a critical security bug where migration file ordering causes a security fix to be immediately overwritten. The alphabetical execution order means the teacher-level RLS restrictions are applied and then completely undone by a subsequent migration, leaving a privilege escalation vulnerability where teachers can access all school referrals via direct API calls. This is non-obvious because it requires understanding Supabase's migration ordering and cross-referencing multiple migration files.

pr_title: fix: improve RLS policy performance (auth initplan + consolidate permissive policies)
summary: Greptile caught a migration ordering bug where two migration files with the same date prefix will execute alphabetically, causing the second migration to recreate individual RLS policies that the first migration had already consolidated. This defeats the performance optimization and reintroduces the "multiple permissive policies" warning the PR was meant to fix.

pr_title: feat(byok): byok for hosted model capabilities
summary: Greptile caught a breaking change where `isHosted` was hardcoded to `true`, which would cause self-hosted deployments to incorrectly behave as if they were the hosted version, affecting billing, authentication, and BYOK functionality.

pr_title: [Refactor] Plugins menu and open plugins in a dedicated window
summary: Greptile caught a null reference bug where `window.show()` would be called on a null/undefined window object after the conditional check, causing a runtime crash when the plugins window doesn't exist yet.

pr_title: Improve templates fetching logic and filtering
summary: Greptile caught a runtime error where the code tries to modify a frozen dataclass field, which would cause a FrozenInstanceError when the template fetching logic runs.

pr_title: improvement(byok): remove web search block exa
summary: This catches an incomplete refactoring where 'exa' was removed from implementation but left in the type definition, causing a type inconsistency that could lead to runtime errors if code tries to use the 'exa' type that no longer has corresponding functionality. This is a subtle oversight that's easy to miss during code review.

pr_title: Optimise Debug Tooling
summary: This is a legitimate logic bug - the memory profile is written immediately after file creation, capturing the heap state at startup rather than after the actual work is done. This would render the memory profiling feature completely useless since it won't capture any memory from the log processing it's meant to profile. The fix correctly uses defer to capture the profile at function exit.

pr_title: fix: Metrics revamp UI fixes
summary: Greptile caught a logic bug where a refactoring split query type selection into two variables, but one conditional still checks the old variable for 'promql' which now only contains 'builder'/'custom' values, causing PromQL-specific logic to never execute.

pr_title: fix: Metrics revamp UI fixes
summary: Greptile caught a logic bug where a variable name check became incorrect after refactoring - the code checks `selectedButtonType` for 'promql' but that variable now holds 'builder'/'custom' values, not 'sql'/'promql' values, causing the PromQL query limit logic to fail silently.

pr_title: refactor: Update form field components to use new hook
summary: This is a real bug - Formik's `field.onChange` indeed expects a React synthetic event with `target.name` and `target.value`, not a raw value. Passing a raw value would fail silently or cause incorrect behavior. The fix to use `helpers.setValue(value)` is correct and this API misuse is non-obvious, especially to developers unfamiliar with Formik's internals.

pr_title: Add Graphics support including basic demo using Sway.
summary: Greptile caught a critical virtio protocol violation where the code consumes input buffers and writes event data to guest memory but fails to update the used ring via `recordUsedElement()`. This means the guest VM never gets notified that buffers contain valid input events, causing input to silently fail and eventually stop working entirely when all buffers are exhausted.

pr_title: feat(journal): add subdirectory format support and migration script
summary: This is a legitimate logic bug - the PR adds subdirectory format support and migration, but the shell script still uses `-maxdepth 1` which will fail to find journals after migration. This would cause real functional breakage and is easy to miss since it's in a different file from the main changes.

pr_title: fix: google index names
summary: Greptile caught a critical data integrity issue where renaming Google embedding index names in the configuration without providing a migration path would break existing deployments. This would cause the system to look for non-existent indexes, making vector stores inaccessible and breaking search functionality for all users of the Google Gemini embedding model.

pr_title: [Dia] fix format of CHANGELOG dates +  fix crash in `search-history` when file not found
summary: This is a legitimate Rules of Hooks violation - having an early return before a hook call (useSQL) violates React's fundamental requirement that hooks be called unconditionally in the same order on every render. This will cause runtime errors and is a non-obvious bug that many developers miss, especially in conditional rendering scenarios.

pr_title: feat: migrate to TypeScript and improve project structure
summary: This is a legitimate security vulnerability in Electron. Setting nodeIntegration: true and contextIsolation: false allows any code running in the renderer process to access Node.js APIs, enabling arbitrary code execution if the window loads untrusted content. This is a well-documented Electron security anti-pattern that could lead to remote code execution.

pr_title: Replace PromoCard with SourceStickersRow in UserEventsList
summary: Greptile caught an iOS-specific bug where deep link stickers would silently fail because the required URL schemes aren't declared in LSApplicationQueriesSchemes, causing 6 out of 7 stickers to be non-functional when tapped. This is a non-obvious iOS platform requirement that would be easy for developers to miss.

pr_title: fix: metrics PromQL Builder UI fixes
summary: Greptile caught a subtle off-by-one style logic bug where using -1 as an index in string slicing causes the function to produce empty strings instead of preserving the input value when building legend templates.

pr_title: feat: new db migration
summary: Greptile caught a data integrity bug where the PostgreSQL adapter fails to properly handle timestamp columns during migration, while MySQL and SQLite adapters handle these correctly. This inconsistency would break incremental migrations when using PostgreSQL as a source.

pr_title: fix(restart): filter out positional arguments (prompts) on restart
summary: Greptile correctly identified that the `-t` short form for `--tools` is missing from `_FLAGS_WITH_VALUES`, which would cause tool arguments to be incorrectly dropped during restart operations.

pr_title: fix: propagate metadata in Anthropic retry decorator
summary: This is a subtle Python generator semantics bug where `yield from` discards the return value while `return (yield from ...)` propagates it. This non-obvious language quirk caused metadata (token counts, costs) to be silently lost, breaking the /cost command. Most developers wouldn't catch this without deep understanding of Python generator return value propagation.

pr_title: feat(codeblock): support quad+ backticks for nested markdown (Issue #1005)
summary: This is a valid logic bug - the code strips closing fences of any length regardless of whether they match the opening fence, which violates CommonMark spec and could incorrectly parse nested markdown blocks. For example, a code block with 5 backticks opening but 3 backticks closing (which should remain as content) would be incorrectly stripped.
